website_summaries.verdict: Very good value for an upgraded baritone, looks good and feels solid.
pros: For the price this is a good horn
It sounds good and is a great choice for someone starting out on the baritone and hoping to grow their skill for several years
cons: This instrument is not strictly a baritone, but can be used as such
The fourth key makes it a euphonium

customer_reviews.title: Very impressed!
customer_reviews.text: Honestly this is much better than I thought it was going to be. You see that in a lot of reviews but it's true. I was looking for something inexpensive to start playing again and this is that and more. Nice looking horn, doesn't feel cheap at all. Really good intonation, no sharp edges, good case. Something like this could easily get a student through their band years and more. With any reasonable care I assume this would last and be playable for a long time.
customer_reviews.author: L. Fesenden

customer_reviews.title: Great starter instrument for the price.
customer_reviews.text: At 60+ I decided I wanted to learn to play a brass instrument and chose Euphonium. I did not want to spend a fortune until I found out if I could do it, so my instructor researched and thought this looked good for the price. He was beyond pleased when he tried it. The sound and action are both good and I have been playing it almost and hour everyday. I have a music background but have never played brass before so I do not have a comparison. Some reviews said they have sticky valves but that has not been the case with this particular instrument. I love it.
customer_reviews.author: Virstone

customer_reviews.title: Low Quality Valves
customer_reviews.text: I loved the euphonium, but started to see discoloration in the valves. The valves started sticking and I added valve oil. I began adding more and more oil and now realize the valves were corroding away. One valve is completely stuck and the rest keep sticking making it impossible to play it any more. If you buy this instrument, make sure you keep an eye on the valves and send your instrument back if you see issues early on, otherwise you'll be stuck with an unusable piece of junk like me.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great instrument, great price!
customer_reviews.text: My son has been in band for 4 years now, and stuck with 1 instrument for 3... So we figured it was time to buy him an instrument instead of rent. They are so expensive though! We found this one and read the reviews, most seemed happy with it so we bought it. My son couldn't be happier with it, and it's nice that it's a little smaller since they started marching this year. I would recommend this to any parent wanting to buy their child their own band instrument.
customer_reviews.author: Justin

customer_reviews.title: As good as a Yamaha in sound production.
customer_reviews.text: My son is the only euphonium player in his schools symphony. He’s always played a Yamaha. In the latest concert he had to play softer because the range, depth, and quality of the Mendini really “blew away” his old Yamaha. He absolutely loves the sound the Mendini makes. His composer and band director couldn’t believe its range. Everyone was very impressed. Such a delicious instrument for such a low price. It sounds better than the Jupiters and Yamahas the school uses. It was really worth the risk.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph Yandow

customer_reviews.title: Great Value.  Exceeded expectations
customer_reviews.text: I did not expect much from this horn, but for the price figured it was not a big risk. Glad that I purchased it. Great way to get back into playing shape for local community bands. Tone and sound quality is really good, slotting in the upper register is loose and can be a little tricky, but can be decent with practice. Finish quality is superb and valves got much better after a few months. With any new horn you should always give it a little while to breakin. No comparison to my pro level Besson sovereign or King 2280, but an incredible intermediate and hobby horn. Large bore big sound.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher M. Prazak

customer_reviews.title: EXACTLY as the description states - per a high school french horn player
customer_reviews.text: I was a mediocre french horn player in high school. My embouchure was off as my lips tended to not wrap snugly around the horn mouth piece. 20 years later, I decided to pick up the euphonium to motivate my kids towards instruments. For the price, the Mendini euphonium is well worth its weight! The valves stick from time to time but a little dab of valve oil (provided) will do the trick. The case is very sturdy and has held up well to my kids riding it like a horse. The only difficulty now is to transition from the treble clef (horn) to the base clef (euphonium)!
customer_reviews.author: AB

customer_reviews.title: First Valve Tuning Issue
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my daughter who plays in her high school band and orchestra. Great price, but she has major issues with the intonation on the first valve. We and her directors have tried having her adjust the first valve slide but it doesn't correct the intonation. I'm not a euph player and not the best tester. I need to find an experienced player to see if it is just an issue with my daughter's embouchure. None of the other review's I've read have mentioned intonation issues.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great value and nice quality
customer_reviews.text: Love the carrying case - the straps make it much easier for my son to carry to and from school. Beautiful instrument and great value for the price. Sound quality is really good for most of the range and it has been a perfect solution for a beginner/intermediate for a fraction of the price. We originally decided to purchase since the cost was comparable with renting a much older used baritone for the school year. So glad we purchased!
customer_reviews.author: Lauren

customer_reviews.title: I love it.  I'm in our weekly adult large church orchestra.  Many compliments on the sound
customer_reviews.text: In the first 2 weeks, the middle valve was slow. But after I ordered Blue Juice valve oil, and played some more, all the valves are very fast. Sound is great - it can sound like a French Horn, a trombone, and a tuba on the low notes. It's a keeper for sure.
customer_reviews.author: J. Rasmussen

customer_reviews.title: Great for beginners!
customer_reviews.text: Intonation isn't perfect, but it's not horrible, and certainly great for this price. Any dedicated student can figure out the slides to get it in tune. The compensating ranger under low F isn't great, but if you need to help the tubas out, it's not that bad, just got to lip down. Pedal Bb down to low pedal F is surprisingly responsive on this. Getting up to high F is easy, high F#,G, and Ab are weird. High A and Bb, B are easy just pitchy.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph Saenz

customer_reviews.title: Great instrument
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my 8th grade son as a Christmas present and he loved it straight out of the box. The instrument Sounds and looks great, and I would definitely recommend especially at this price range. The case is also very nice and appears to be durable and practical for every day use.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not to shabby
customer_reviews.text: I am happy with this purchase. I know that some of the Mendini instruments do get a bad rep, but this my first from this company, and the euphonium was not that bad. I opened the box and picked the instrument up, and started playing like I was in middle school. My daughter loved it and wants me to show her how to play it some time soon. I choose the gold colored over the silver because of the 40 some dollar price difference.
customer_reviews.author: reviewing stuff

customer_reviews.title: I am very pleased with this horn
customer_reviews.text: As a retired high school band director, I am very pleased with this horn. all the valves work very well, I had already ordered a 6 !/2 AL. I ordered a silver plated horn, but they sent a lacquerd one. Amazon gave me a $100.00 refund, via a chat with NO problems.
customer_reviews.author: Edwin K. Roberts

customer_reviews.title: Great when assembled correctly!!
customer_reviews.text: Great for beginners, just be careful to make certain it is assembled correctly. I knew nothing about how to put together so my first year band student was getting frustrated by the sound she was getting. My college student came home on break and noticed two of the valves were in the wrong spots. Thank heavens for siblings!
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: I was delighted to find this 4 valve Bb Euphonium to be ...
customer_reviews.text: While definitely not as 'heavy metal' (literally) as more expensive horns, I was delighted to find this 4 valve Bb Euphonium to be a very nice instrument to play, with excellent construction and features, and the hard case is super, very light yet great protection. The low cost should not deter anyone from thinking otherwise.
customer_reviews.author: Paul

customer_reviews.title: This is great!
customer_reviews.text: My high school daughter just received this baritone and is thrilled. It is a nice instrument and the case is good quality and comes with a tuner, valve oil, cloth, and gloves. Very happy especially for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Snupydecat

customer_reviews.title: Awesome for the price
customer_reviews.text: Awesome for the price. I am pleased with the tone and overall quality of this euphonium. After 33 years of not playing an instrument, I joined a community band. For this purpose, I certainly don't need a professional or even a Yamaha euphonium. I feel I made the right choice with this one. It would be great for a student or someone learning or relearning to play. The tuner and the case are a nice bonus.
customer_reviews.author: donna j searcy

customer_reviews.title: Can't beat the price
customer_reviews.text: Got this for my goddaughter. She needed a practice instrument for home so no need to lug around her school piece. 8 th grade, she loves it. Nicely made for the price point
customer_reviews.author: tony

customer_reviews.title: Nice Horn for the Price
customer_reviews.text: I recommend this horn for middle and high schoolers. The valves need a little work. I suggest washing the valve pistons in baking soda. The upper range can slip out of tune, so keep a strong embouchure. So if you need a horn just to play on. This is a good buy.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Sounds good
customer_reviews.text: Been wanting a euphonium for a while. I bought this one used and I am very happy with it. Sounds fine. I just need to build up my lungs.
customer_reviews.author: calliecarrot

customer_reviews.title: I think this is a good quality. I have not played in years and ...
customer_reviews.text: I think this is a good quality. I have not played in years and owning my own instrument has been great.
customer_reviews.author: Tomas Flores

customer_reviews.title: Sounds good for the price
customer_reviews.text: Worked well for my 4th grader school band. The teacher was impressed. Didn’t want to pay over 2 grands from school rental. My son loves it, sounds very good
customer_reviews.author: Eric Ao

customer_reviews.title: Great For A Music Junkie Like Myself
customer_reviews.text: This was a purchase I could never regret, I am a music junkie and when I saw this Euphonium for a reasonable price I was ecstatic to say the least. When I got to open the box up to a brand new instrument is was like Christmas and the quality was very good for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Average Consumer

customer_reviews.title: It's freaking great!
customer_reviews.text: I love this instrument, I play grade 6 music on it and it holds up great. I've had it for about a year and the biggest issue i've had with it, is the tuning slides had a tendency to fall out while I was playing it, But I took it to the repair shop and had the tubes extended and it works beautifully now. I highly encourage you to buy this instrument if you are just starting out, or wanting something new but not sure what it is. It is a great horn for the price!
customer_reviews.author: Triston

customer_reviews.title: Very easy to learn to play.
customer_reviews.text: Light & easy to hold, good for marchingor solo work.
customer_reviews.author: Beyond Ken

customer_reviews.title: Mouthpiece Issue
customer_reviews.text: Sound is good but only the mouthpiece that comes with it fits. You can't use one of your own favorites.
customer_reviews.author: RF

customer_reviews.title: Great Product
customer_reviews.text: Extremely pleased with the Mendini MEP-N Nickel Plated B Flat Euphonium. I would recommend this product as a very good purchase.
customer_reviews.author: B Walker

customer_reviews.title: this instrument is great i have had it for about six months and ...
customer_reviews.text: this instrument is great i have had it for about six months and it is still doing good the valves all work wonderfully and and the tuning slides fit perfectly it has a nice roomy sound even when played loudly or softly
customer_reviews.author: another dude on amazon

customer_reviews.title: Good Value
customer_reviews.text: Good value. The horn plays well and the sound is good. However, the placement of the spit valves were did not allow the user to empty the spit. I had to remove the tuning slides to empty the spit.
customer_reviews.author: Kenneth M.

customer_reviews.title: Good for beginner.  Just keep it lubed.
customer_reviews.text: After two decades of not playing, I bought this so play in order to help my daughter learn trumpet. This is a great instrument for the price. As soon I got it I took it to her school teacher to try out and he loved it. The only reason I'm giving it four stars is because of the valves. They seem to be made from cheaper metal that requires more lubing and cleaning then normal. If I don't play it for about a week, they tend to get quite stuck. There's even some discoloring on the valves from where the solid parts rest against the openings of the pipes when not pushed down.
customer_reviews.author: MAJF

customer_reviews.title: Really impressed
customer_reviews.text: I've been playing Euphonium for 9 years and I think I can say you can't be the quality you get for the price. Now it's not the Yamaha 842 I was used to playing on but it definitely get's the job done. It's a little hard to get some notes in tune which for me is painfully obvious while I play. All that being said for beginners, this instrument is a perfect buy.
customer_reviews.author: Jesus

customer_reviews.title: Love this instrument!
customer_reviews.text: It was purchased for my neighbor's son, who says he absolutley loves it. He told me it doesn't hurt his fingers like the "borrowed" one from the school. Thank you for supplying access to quality products. I have never been disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Sandra Watts

customer_reviews.title: Quality
customer_reviews.text: Bad alligation, air comes by. It can be seen on picture.
customer_reviews.author: darsy

customer_reviews.title: The response and tone of the instrument is quite nice. The intonation is a little off here and ...
customer_reviews.text: Bought this horn for a show I'm playing in where the tuba (my usual main instrument) doubles on Euphonium. The response and tone of the instrument is quite nice. The intonation is a little off here and there, but the "slots" are wide enough that the pitches can be bent into tune as needed. Nice case, too!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: B flat baritone/ euphonium
customer_reviews.text: Was really satisfied with the packaging and with how the instrument was presented. Loved the four valve and sound that it makes.Love the case that it came in; it comes with everything it says it comes with.Noticed that it has a small stain on the lower neck of the euphonium, where it connects. Figured that it was probably the way it was manufactured/made. The slides and valves were well greased. Happy with my new instrument. I am a junior music major at a university and well, this horn has a Great difficulty in tuning...I've noticed when I play high G.
customer_reviews.author: judi

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: Loud valves and not as mechanically smooth as other instruments. Inexpensive though.
customer_reviews.author: polar

customer_reviews.title: Good quality instrument and very reasonably priced
customer_reviews.text: My son's teacher is very impressed by the quality of the instrument and has recommended it to other students. My son is very pleased with the tone and the ease of playing.
customer_reviews.author: julie

customer_reviews.title: Pretty Amazing!
customer_reviews.text: Im in Band Varsity, and for the past few years I feel in love with the Euphonium. I just needed one of my own !! The Euph. came in perfect condition. It is safe and secure in the case that comes along with it, and everything works great. The met. is great for tuning and keeping beat. Make sure to wash the mouthpiece when you first use it though, the scent is strong the first few uses.. Regionals came along last week, and this amazing instrument got me first place :) LOVE IT. I would definately consider buying.
customer_reviews.author: Tabitha Montaner

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Beautiful instrument for the price. Nice tone. great horn for all skill levels.
customer_reviews.author: Staci Hunt

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my daughter and she loves it. We have gotten so many compliments on it. It is beautiful and plays very well.
customer_reviews.author: Nichole Romero

customer_reviews.title: Economy drove my purchase, so I took a chance.....
customer_reviews.text: I rate this horn only three stars. Initial inspection revealed no apparent defects. Upon further review, I found that the slide for 2nd valve was loose and would slip out from either vibration or air pressure while playing. The spit valves are aligned poorly, just glad they do not leak air or spit. Overall tone is good from low notes to higher range. As a student or practice horn, I would give it a passing grade. Amazingly light weight...The gifts are s***. Pros might be amused, but no. For what I need, economy and lightweight, it'll do.
customer_reviews.author: Roy M. Larrabee

customer_reviews.title: Great value
customer_reviews.text: Very well finished instrument with free-moving pistons. Excellent case. The sound is certainly good enough for the amateur player - compared to something like a Boosey & Hawkes it's about 10% of the price and for the average bandsman that makes it a steal. The tuner that comes with it doesn't seem to function but that's not important - I have another anyway. Really good buy.
customer_reviews.author: Bramwell Wright

customer_reviews.title: Excellent value for middle school - high school band
customer_reviews.text: My son, his band teacher, and his music lessons teacher are all very happy with this purchase. It makes a good sound and is comfortable for him to play, and the price is outstanding, less than one year of instrument rentals where we live.
customer_reviews.author: HJS

customer_reviews.title: This horn is quite good and the price is outstanding
customer_reviews.text: I needed this to play as a secondary instrument in a beginner adult (over 55) band....I am a wind player , retired band director....This horn is quite good and the price is outstanding....not for the serious player...but a student....a great buy
customer_reviews.author: Donna G.

customer_reviews.title: Chinese Euphonium
customer_reviews.text: I received the horn in new condition and now am trying to get used to the fourth valve. My one concern is the depth and quality of thread on the on the valve caps.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Juulsen

customer_reviews.title: nice gift
customer_reviews.text: i chose this instrument as a gift for my brother's 30th birthday. his birthday kind of snuck up on me and i was in a rush to find something nice and in the price range. it was a better price than i could have dreamed and it arrived less than a week after i ordered (and just in time!). i won't say it is the best ever made, but it is nicer than i could have hoped for. he is a great player and the horn sounded wonderful, i'm so glad to have him back playing!
customer_reviews.author: nicole brown

customer_reviews.title: Another satisfied customer!!!
customer_reviews.text: The price was good .The quality was very good and the delivery was also good. It seems to.be easy to play. It's the only Euphonium that I have owned but, it's just what I was looking for. I have purchased several instruments from Cecilio and have always been satisfied with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Stanley Hodgin

customer_reviews.title: its a baritone
customer_reviews.text: This horn is NOT a tuba. It is a baritone. It plays the octive that is that of a baritone. Which is one octive higher than that of a tuba. The mouth piece is the same as a baritone, the construction is not going to accomadate the lower octive. Anyone expecting a tuba should not get this instrument. Ive played tuba since 1977, ive got to return this for a tuba.
customer_reviews.author: antman

product_meta.title: Mendini MEP-L Lacquer Brass B Flat Euphonium with Stainless Steel Pistons, Gold
product_meta.description: Color:GoldMendini by Cecilio MEP-L is Bb Euphonium (better known as the "mini" tuba or "tenor" tuba) with beautiful gold lacquered finish. Its large bore tubing is combined with a 12" upright bell to project its rich sound. The 4 top action valves with stainless steel pistons and lightweight design make for the ideal choice for the student musician.
feature_bullets: Lacquered Yellow brass body and bell Bb euphonium with rose-brass lead pipe
Lightweight, .566" bore, 12" upright bell, 4 stainless steel smooth top action pistons
Includes: silver plated mouthpiece, pro-deluxe hard case, polishing cloth and a pair of gloves
Bonus: Cecilio 92-D chromatic/string tuner with metronome
